etymology.description: pictogram: some kind of container; later borrowed phonetically for ‘bean’; displaced Old Chinese 菽 (shū); unrelated to the bottom of 豊.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a lidded vessel or ceremonial container. Its sound was later borrowed to write the word for beans/legumes, supplanting the older term 菽, while the pictorial container form remained.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃黄豆和黑豆(我喜歡吃黃豆和黑豆)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī huángdòu hé hēidòu.
examples.english: I like to eat soybeans and black beans.

examples.chinese: 这道甜品是用红豆煮成的(這道甜品是用紅豆煮成的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào tiánpǐn shì yòng hóngdòu zhǔ chéng de.
examples.english: This dessert is made with red beans.

examples.chinese: 豆类富含蛋白质，对素食者很重要(豆類富含蛋白質，對素食者很重要)。
examples.pinyin: Dòulèi fùhán dànbáizhì, duì sùshízhě hěn zhòngyào.
examples.english: Legumes are rich in protein and are important for vegetarians.
